thread.title: General Election 2017 LIVE: Newcastle and the North East head to the polls

author: Tom Eden
title: General Election 2017 LIVE: Newcastle and the North East head to the polls
text:
'Improvements are needed to the education system' 
Mr Kellagher said: 
“It’s your democratic right to vote. If you don’t vote, don’t complain about what’s happening in the country.” 
He said improvements are needed to the education system and to pensioners’ quality of life. 
He added: 
“They all start arguing with each other and it’s difficult to hear what they’re actually going to offer you.” 12:20 Tom Eden 
I wonder how many others have actually read the manifestos... 
They said they wanted to see which party would be good for the country and would deal with issues like healthcare and the economy well. 12:12 Tom Eden North Shields polling station 
On her travels around North Tyneside, Sonia is now at St Augustine’s Church in North Shields : 
Alan said: 
“It was very difficult to decide who to vote for. In this election there are some very important issues to address.” North Tyneside Tom Eden 'Brexit an important issue' 
One voter says he cast his vote in light of the UK’s decision to vote to leave the European Union: 
Here are some other concerns at the ballot box: 11:22 More North Tyneside polling stations 
Sonia has now made her way over to Hadrian Park Primary School: 
“A string of voters have been going in. 
“It’s good to see the rain is not putting people off.” 
I’ll have a full weather update shortly. 11:18 Tom Eden Diane Abbott pictured after stepping aside as Shadow Home Secretary 
Diane Abbott has been pictured at her polling station in Hackney after stepping aside as Shadow Home Secretary. 
Jeremy Corbyn announced yesterday how Ms Abbott would be replaced temporarily while she suffers from a ‘period of ill health. 
She was replaced an an interim basis by shadow policing minister Lyn Brown. 
A statement from the party yesterday morning said: 
“Jeremy Corbyn, leader of the Labour Party , has asked Lyn Brown to stand in for Diane Abbott as Shadow Home Secretary for the period of her ill health.” 11:05 Why do we vote on Thursdays? 
Wondering why voting is (almost) always on a Thursday? 
Here’s why: Tom Eden Labour banner flying across the UK? 
Buzzfeed’s Jim Waterson has heard that a plane with a Labour banner is flying through the skies today: Share
